definition: to turn out to be true/verified/true
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on

sentences.english: The Russian Defense Ministry dismissed claims of the airport bombing as disinformation .
sentences.chinese: 俄国防部指出关于轰炸机场的消息并不属实。

sentences.english: If so, can you introduce relevant details?
sentences.chinese: 如属实，你能否介绍相关信息？

sentences.english: If so, what is the reason behind it?
sentences.chinese: 如果属实，是出于什么原因？

sentences.english: The detectives swore out a search warrant.
sentences.chinese: 侦探宣誓所控属实后领到一张搜查证。

sentences.english: She swore out a warrant for the arrest of the man who stole her car.
sentences.chinese: 她宣誓所控属实，因此领到了偷她车那个人的逮捕证。

sentences.english: I don't know if this is true, but it seems to work for power lifters and martial-arts gurus.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道这是否属实，但是好像在拼搏的时候很有效。

sentences.english: If the exposure is true to the fact, the traffic administrative department of the public security organ shall grant awards.
sentences.chinese: 举报属实的，公安机关交通管理部门应当给予奖励。

sentences.english: Go make a list of everything she said and mark the points that are true.
sentences.chinese: 把她挑的毛病列成一个单子，把属实的意见标出来。

sentences.english: As the information provided by the applicant is found to be true, the application is approved.
sentences.chinese: 经查申请人上述填写资料属实，同意所请。

sentences.english: I have no idea if these stories are even partially true.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道这些故事哪怕有半句属实。

sentences.english: Violation of this regulation will result in the denial of admission.
sentences.chinese: 违反规定经查证属实者，取消其入学资格。

sentences.english: Reporters then unannounced visits to some sites found that most of the public to report true.
sentences.chinese: 记者随后对部分场所暗访发现，市民举报大多属实。

sentences.english: The appointer declares that all the related information provided by the company is reliable.
sentences.chinese: 委任人声明本公司所提供之相关资料均属实在。

sentences.english: If the report is proved to be true, the said department shall give them rewards.
sentences.chinese: 举报属实的，公安机关交通管理部门应当给予奖励。

sentences.english: No one in the room asked the President or Alejos if the allegations were true.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里没人质问总统或阿莱霍斯这些指控是否属实。

sentences.english: Applicant hereby represents that the information provided in this questionnaire is true and correct.
sentences.chinese: 申请人在此声明所胡此申请表内讯息属实。

definition: to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
to declare to be untrue/to deny
